titles.title: Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
To modify the boundary of the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site in Washington, District of Columbia.
Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire property abutting the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site in Washington, D.C. to be used for visitor orientation, administrative purposes, archival storage, facilities for researchers, and accessibility for handicapped persons.
